==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|くつ|k1=くっ|ふく|k2=ぷく|yomi=o}}

===Etymology===
Alternative spelling of {{m|ja|屈服|tr=kuppuku}}, replacing the {{m|ja|服}} character that is more often used in Japanese to mean {{m|en|clothes}}, {{m|en|clothing}}, with the homophonous {{m|ja|伏}} character that means {{m|en|prostrate}}, {{m|en|bend}} ''down''.  See the {{m|ja|屈服}} entry for more details.

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|くっぷく}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=くっぷく|屈服}}: [[surrender]], [[submission]], or [[subjection]] {{qualifier|as to a ruler or other authority}}
# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=くっぷく|屈服}}: [[prostration]], [[kowtowing]]

===Verb===
{{ja-verb-suru|くっぷく}}

# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=くっぷく|屈服}}: to [[surrender]], [[submit]], or [[subject]] oneself {{qualifier|as to a ruler or other authority}}
# {{alternative spelling of|lang=ja|sort=くっぷく|屈服}}: to [[prostrate]] oneself
